title: Systematic vs Idiosyncratic Risk: Proxy Measurement
hypothesis: Structural defects in always-load files (CORE.md, PRINCIPLES.md) propagate to ALL spawned agents (= systematic risk, undiversifiable). Per-agent hallucinations appear in ~1/N sessions and wash out in ensemble (= idiosyncratic risk, diversifiable).
method: Proxy measurement on existing swarm data: (1) belief embedding rate in principles, (2) lesson error classification (5 sampled), (3) SESSION-LOG correction propagation analysis

measurement_1_belief_embedding.description: How many of the 17 active beliefs appear in multiple principles (= systematic multi-point embedding)?
measurement_1_belief_embedding.interpretation: 76.5% of beliefs are systematically embedded across 2+ principles. A wrong belief propagates not to 1 principle but to an average of ~3-5 principles. This confirms systematic multi-point infection: one wrong belief in CORE.md would surface as errors across dozens of principles that all depend on it.

examples.B6_stigmergy_architecture: 6 principles (P-063, P-082, P-101, P-154, P-155, P-173) — a wrong belief about stigmergy would corrupt all 6
examples.B7_protocols_compound: 6 principles (P-039, P-108, P-146, P-147, P-163, P-188) — a wrong belief about protocol compounding corrupts maintenance/compaction logic
examples.B15_CAP_theorem: 0 principles — not yet embedded; remains idiosyncratic if wrong (contained failure)

measurement_2_lesson_errors.description: Classify errors in 5 sampled lessons as idiosyncratic (single-lesson) vs systematic (multi-lesson same error)

details.error: B1 scope overstated (git works at any scale)

details.propagation: single-harvest; R3 refined it, not another independent session

details.error: F96 overgeneralized NK-EH to DAG languages
details.propagation: single cross-language test corrected; no other lesson repeated misconception

measurement_2_lesson_errors.finding: 5/5 sampled lesson errors are idiosyncratic. No repeated identical misconception found across independent lesson-writing sessions.

measurement_3_propagation_analysis.description: SESSION-LOG correction events: do corrections to beliefs propagate systematically or stay isolated?

systematic_examples.propagation: 100% forward propagation; every session after S69 loaded the corrected belief

systematic_examples.event: B4/B5 superseded — K=0 isolated beliefs removed (early sessions)
systematic_examples.propagation: 100% forward propagation; belief graph restructuring is permanent

systematic_examples.event: P-089 substrate caveat — same-LLM 6/6 = test not adopt (S98)
systematic_examples.affected_sessions: S175, R5 harvest, and all sessions referencing P-089
systematic_examples.propagation: Systematic: principle correction propagated through PRINCIPLES.md reads
Systematic: status upgrade propagated to paper, index, and future lessons

idiosyncratic_examples.propagation: None; isolated arithmetic error in per-session context

idiosyncratic_examples.event: P-122 subsumption into P-119 not tracked (S181/S81c)
L-209 B4 reference wrong (should be I10) — S168

measurement_3_propagation_analysis.key_insight: The propagation mechanism is FILE LAYER, not error type. Corrections to always-load files (CORE.md, DEPS.md, PHILOSOPHY.md, PRINCIPLES.md) = 100% forward propagation. Corrections to per-session artifacts (NEXT.md, count headers, local lesson references) = isolated 1-2 sessions.

synthesis.systematic_risk_finding: Confirmed: beliefs embedded in always-load files (CORE.md, PHILOSOPHY.md, PRINCIPLES.md) propagate to ALL downstream sessions. Structural defects in these files ARE undiversifiable — every session reading CORE.md inherits the defect. Embedding rate = 76.5% (13/17 beliefs in 2+ principles).
synthesis.idiosyncratic_risk_finding: Confirmed: per-session errors (count drift, incorrect local references, per-agent hallucinations) are isolated to 1-2 sessions. 5/5 sampled lesson errors were idiosyncratic — no misconception repeated independently across separate sessions.
synthesis.diversification_asymmetry: The topology is the mechanism. A wrong belief in CORE.md survives compaction, cross-variant harvest, and child-swarm propagation. A wrong count in NEXT.md dies with the session.
synthesis.finance_isomorphism_strength: STRUCTURAL (not just analogy): The systematic/idiosyncratic distinction maps exactly to load-order topology. Always-load = market beta (all sessions exposed). Per-session artifacts = firm-specific alpha (session-specific, decorrelates).
synthesis.open_sub_question: Quantitative propagation rate not yet measured directly (would require injecting a controlled wrong belief into CORE.md temporarily and measuring N children). Proxy method confirms the topology; direct injection would confirm the magnitude.

limitations: Belief embedding manually counted (not regex-automated due to conceptual rather than ID-based citation)
Lesson error sample is small (n=5); could be selection bias toward documented errors
Correction propagation cases are researcher-identified, not exhaustive
Direct controlled injection not performed (avoids CORE.md corruption risk)
